definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish

sentences.english: Yesterday I made mistakes, then I correct them today and warn myself not to mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我犯錯了，於是我今天改過並告誡自己不可重犯。

sentences.english: If you turn a deaf ear to my warnings, you'll land in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你對我的告誡充耳不聞，你就會惹麻煩的。

sentences.english: To warn others against marrying those whom they have no reason to esteem. (No. 35)
sentences.chinese: 要告誡人們去反對那些沒有尊重基礎的婚姻。

sentences.english: As told me recover spirit, waiting for a long time the rain in July.
sentences.chinese: 好像在告誡我恢復心神，去守候七月一場久違的雨景。

sentences.english: My father also kept telling them to hide the cameras.
sentences.chinese: 因此，父親也一再告誡他們要把攝影機藏好。

sentences.english: They were cautioned to speak as little as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他們得到告誡要儘量少說話。

sentences.english: It is also an admonishment to people to not deceive themselves or others.
sentences.chinese: 並也告誡人們不要做自欺欺人的蠢事。

sentences.english: The weatherman warned us that the roads were icy.
sentences.chinese: 氣象員告誡我們說路面有冰凍。

sentences.english: It would not be inappropriate for a pastor to admonish those who appear to have the wrong priorities in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 牧師告誡那些似乎有錯誤優先順序的人，並無不當。

sentences.english: And, thirdly, Doctor Chan warned of a continued threat of  pandemic influenza.
sentences.chinese: 第三，陳博士告誡應注意大規模流感的持續威脅。

sentences.english: The policeman warned the children against roller-skating in the street.
sentences.chinese: 警察告誡孩子們不要在馬路上溜旱冰。

sentences.english: Admonish your friend privately , but praise them openly.
sentences.chinese: 要私下告誡朋友，但要公開誇獎朋友。

sentences.english: She dumped the dream XiaoWei a slap, warned her from seith.
sentences.chinese: 她甩了夢曉薇一耳光，告誡她遠離呂磊。

sentences.english: Those precepts are only of limited help to the youngsters glued to the Internet cafe.
sentences.chinese: 那些告誡對沈迷於網咖的青少年幫助有限。

sentences.english: A child can wade across them without a parent's cautions.
sentences.chinese: 無須父母的告誡，孩子們就可以涉水而過。

sentences.english: Delio Rossi has warned Lazio president Claudio Lotito that money must be spent this summer.
sentences.chinese: 羅西告誡主席這個夏天必須花錢購買些球員。

definition: to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
